title.narrative: OECD - multidimensional country reviews Western Balkan

description.narrative:
Projektet genomförs av Organisationen för ekonomiskt samarbete och utveckling (OECD) och syftar till att utveckla en multidimensionell översyn (MDR) av Västra Balkan, med särskilt fokus på Albanien, Bosnien och Hercegovina, Kosovo, Nord Makedonien och Serbien. Projektet har en förväntad total budget om 12,1 MSEK och ska genomföras under perioden 2019-2021.
Projektets mål är att bistå länderna i regionen att uppnå en effektivare utveckling genom att identifiera ländernas ekonomiska, sociala, miljömässiga och institutionella hinder. Översynen syftar till att förbättra den strategiska inriktningen och bevisbasen för utvecklingsstrategier och -policies och förbättra genomförandet av dessa genom att 1) Identifiera de viktigaste utmaningarna och möjligheterna till inkluderande och hållbar utveckling i länderna i regionen, 2) Möjliggöra regional peer learning och kunskapsöverföring från internationella erfarenheter relevanta för regionen och 3) Ge regeringar politiska rekommendationer för att ta itu med de utmaningar som identifierats.

The project implemented by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) aims to develop a multi-dimensional review (MDR) for the Western Balkans, with specific focus on Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo, North Macedonia and Serbia. The project is to be implemented with an expected total budget of 12,1 MSEK during a period of two years 2019- 2021 commencing in 2019.
The objective of the project is to assist the countries of the region achieve more effective development. The review aims to enhance the strategic orientation and evidence-base of development strategies and policies and improving implementation by: 1) Identify the most important constraints and key capabilities to inclusive and sustainable development in the countries of the region, 2) Enable regional peer learning and knowledge transfer from international experiences relevant to the region and 3) Provide governments with policy recommendations to address the key constraints identified.

The project implemented by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) aims to develop a multi-dimensional review (MDR) for the Western Balkans, with specific focus on Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo, Macedonia and Serbia. The project is to be implemented with an expected total budget of 12,1 MSEK during a period of two years 2019- 2021. The project consists of an inception phase, three main phases, followed by a peer exchange process, the publication of the final report and dissemination activities. The three main phases are an assessment and narrative phase, an in-depth analysis and an analysis to action process.The primary objective of the project is to assist the countries in the region achieve more effective development. The review aims to enhance the strategic orientation and evidence-base of development strategies and policies and improving implementation. The projects end result will be a report, to be presented at a high-level event and published in English accessible through the OECD website. The report will provide an initial assessment and narrative analysis, identifying the countries key capabilities and constraints and exploring the narratives of development in the region. The report will examine the identified constraints for each country as well as from a regional perspective, from which policy recommendations will be developed. Finally the report will consist of suggestions for actions, ensuring that the recommendations are implementable and translatable into applicable and coherent development strategies, at both country and regional level.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

tag.narrative: 17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.

17.16 - Enhance the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development, complemented by multi-stakeholder partnerships that mobilize and share knowledge, expertise, technology and financial resources, to support the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals in all countries, in particular developing countries

17.16 - Enhance the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development, complemented by multi-stakeholder partnerships that mobilize and share knowledge, expertise, technology and financial resources, to support the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals in all countries, in particular developing countries.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.6 - Enhance North-South, South-South and triangular regional and international cooperation on and access to science, technology and innovation and enhance knowledge-sharing on mutually agreed terms, including through improved coordination among existing mechanisms, in particular at the United Nations level, and through a global technology facilitation mechanism.

17.6 - Stärka nord–syd-samarbetet, syd–syd-samarbetet och det regionala och internationella trepartssamarbetet kring och tillgången till vetenskap, teknik och innovation samt öka kunskapsutbytet på gemensamt överenskomna villkor, inklusive genom förbättrad samordning mellan befintliga mekanismer, i synnerhet på FN-nivå, och genom en global mekanism för teknikfrämjande.

17.9 - Enhance international support for implementing effective and targeted capacity-building in developing countries to support national plans to implement all the Sustainable Development Goals, including through North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation.

17.9 - Öka det internationella stödet för genomförande av effektiv och riktad kapacitetsuppbyggnad i utvecklingsländerna till stöd för nationella planer för att genomföra alla målen för hållbar utveckling, inklusive genom samarbete nord–syd och syd–syd samt trepartssamarbete.

title.narrative: Agreement Sida-OECD, Support to the Multi-Dimensional Review WB
Beslut om insats, OECD multidimensionella landöversynder västra Balkan

description.narrative:
The project started with an inception phase. The inception phase focused on establishing the right contacts, attracting country participation at the appropriate level and putting in place a governance structure. This work was done in close collaboration with the Swedish embassies in the region, whom assisted in introducing OECD to respective government and in identifying the most adequate counterpart.
During fall 2019 a focal point team from each participating country was successfully identified and the MDR successfully introduced. The focal point teams are either located in core of a government entity such as Presidency or Prime Minister´s office, or a cross-cutting line ministry or agency such as Ministry or Agency for Planning, Ministry of Economy, etc.
During beginning of 2020 full missions for initial assessments were conducted and OECD travelled to Albania, Kosovo, North Macedonia and Serbia. During each mission the following activities took place: visioning workshops with representatives from the public sector, the private sector and civil society (NGOs, think-tanks, academia), bilateral meetings with representatives from the public sector, private sector, civil society, regional and international institutions, and collection of information, data and documents required for the Review. The workshops provided OECD with valuable inputs for their work, for example the countries' vision for development and challenges that need to be addressed from the perspective of citizens.
Due to the outbreak of Covid-19 the mission that was planned for Bosnia and Herzegovina had to be cancelled. As an alternative for the mission a questionnaire and data requests was sent to the BiH country focal point to distribute across relevant institutions. The objective was to obtain the information and data that OECD were not able to get due to the cancelled mission.
In February 2022 the draft report was presented and discussed during two days in the mutual learning group. The final country reports were launched at events in respective countries in April and May. The report for Serbia is still to be launched, tentatively in June. Several countries have mentioned that the report has already been used as an input in preparation for new national strategies. For example both Kosovo and Albania would use the recommendations in their upcoming strategies on education.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
